abstract: Shareholders of Bank of America stripped Kenneth D. Lewis of his post as chairman on Wednesday while allowing him to remain president and chief executive, in a vote that may mark the beginning of the end of his leadership at the embattled bank.
snippet: Shareholders of Bank of America stripped Kenneth D. Lewis of his post as chairman on Wednesday while allowing him to remain president and chief executive, in a vote that may mark the beginning of the end of his leadership at the embattled bank.
lead_paragraph: Update | 6:39 p.m. Shareholders of Bank of America stripped Kenneth D. Lewis of his post as chairman on Wednesday while allowing him to remain president and chief executive, in a vote that may mark the beginning of the end of his leadership at the embattled bank, The New York Times’s Louise Story reports from Charlotte, N.C.

headline.main: BofA Shareholders Oust Lewis as Chairman
